question.title: Using libraries with IntelliJ
question.body:

answers.body:
DirectoryScanner class is in two libraries:

  • org.apache.tools.ant.DirectoryScanner; and

  • org.codehaus.plexus.util.

They are not the same, they are similar in purpose (both scan directories) but come from different libraries and projects.

So youâ€™ll need to choose one, and add its dependency to your pom.xml.

Apache Ant's DirectoryScanner

Maven dependency:

<dependency>
  <groupId>org.apache.ant</groupId>
  <artifactId>ant</artifactId>
  <version>1.10.14</version>
</dependency>

This is the classic and very commonly used directory scanner.

It works great if you just need basic directory/file filtering using patterns.

Test code:

import org.apache.tools.ant.DirectoryScanner;

public class DirectoryScannerExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        // Set the base directory to scan
        String baseDir = "src"; // or any directory you'd like to scan

        DirectoryScanner scanner = new DirectoryScanner();
        scanner.setBasedir(baseDir);
        
        // Include all .java files
        scanner.setIncludes(new String[] {"**/*.java"});

        // Exclude any directories or files as needed
        scanner.setExcludes(new String[] {"**/test/**"}); // optional

        scanner.scan();

        String[] files = scanner.getIncludedFiles();

        System.out.println("Files found:");
        for (String file : files) {
            System.out.println(file);
        }
    }
}
